title: ULA's Rocket Launch Plans for 2025
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) is a company that launches rockets into space. Last year, they hoped to launch up to 10 of their new Vulcan rockets in 2025, but they will only launch one this year. They are still busy with other rockets like the Atlas V, which will fly five times. The Vulcan rocket had its only flight in August for the US Space Force, carrying important satellites. ULA works with big customers like Amazon and the Space Force to send satellites for internet and security. Delays happened because of a problem with the rocket's boosters in 2024. Now, more Vulcan launches are planned for next year to catch up.

keywords.explanation: A vehicle that flies into space, carrying satellites or people
An object sent into space to orbit Earth, used for things like GPS or internet
The act of sending a rocket into space from the ground
A company that builds and launches rockets for space missions
A part of the US military that handles space operations and security
When something happens later than planned

background_read: ULA is a rocket company formed by Boeing and Lockheed Martin. They launch satellites for customers like the US military and Amazon. Rockets like Vulcan are new and need testing before regular use. Space launches help with GPS, internet, and spying from space. Delays can happen if parts don't work right, affecting plans.
Article_Structure: WHO: United Launch Alliance (ULA), its CEO Tory Bruno, customers like Amazon and US Space Force
WHAT: ULA planned many Vulcan rocket launches but will only have one in 2025 due to delays
WHERE: Launches happen at places like Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida
WHY: Delays occurred from a booster malfunction, affecting military and commercial satellite deployments

perspectives.description: They are working to increase launches but face challenges with new rocket technology
Concerned about delays because satellites are waiting on the ground, affecting space security
Focused on launching internet satellites with ULA and other rockets to compete with services like Starlink
